title: The international encyclopedia of media studies : media history and the foundations of media studies

contents: Volume I. Media History and the Foundations of Media Studies. Media Studies: The Interdiscipline of the Present and the Future / Angharad N. Valdivia -- Introduction: Mapping the Field of Media History / John Nerone -- Part 1. Approaches. Left Behind: End Times for a Media History Paradigm / Carolyn Marvin -- The Two Marxes: Bridging the Political Economy/Technology and Culture Divide / Vincent Mosco -- The Conditions of Media's Possibility: A Foucauldian Approach to Media History / Jeremy Packer -- Race/Ethnicity in Media History / Catherine Squires -- Approaches to Gender and Sexuality in Media History / Gretchen Soderlund -- The History of the Book / Ronald J. Zboray and Mary Saracino Zboray -- Part 2. Moments. Writing / John Durham Peters -- The Enlightenment and the Bourgeois Public Sphere (Through the Eyes of a London Merchant-Writer) / Juraj Kittler -- Journalism History: North America / Richard Kaplan -- Journalism History: Europe / Jürgen Wilke -- Journalism History: Korea / Sae-Eun Kim -- Journalism History:China / Shihua Chen and Qian Wang -- Communications Networks in the United States: From Chappe to Marconi / Richard R. John -- Quickening Urgency: The Telegraph and Wire Services in 1846-1893 / Terhi Rantanen -- Photography / Craig Robertson -- Moving Images: Portable Histories of Film Exhibition / Haidee Wasson -- Sound Histories: Communication, Technology, Media, and Fidelity / Eric W. Rothenbuhler -- Television / Laurie Ouellette -- The Culture Industries / Frederick Wasser -- Advertising and Consumer Culture: A Historical Review / Inger L. Stole -- The Rise of the Professional Communicator / Kevin G. Barnhurst -- The New World Information and Communication Order: An Idea That Refuses to Die / Kaarle Nordenstreng -- Text, Translation, and the End of the Unified Press / David Alan Grier -- Media and Mobility / Mark Andrejevic -- Part 3. Foundations. Communication and Democracy: The Roots of Media Studies / Hanno Hardt -- The Chicago School of Sociology and Mass Communication Research: Rise, Rejection, Incorporation, and Rediscovery / Karin Wahl-Jorgensen -- Propaganda Studies: The US Interwar Years / Sue Collins -- Frankfurt School, Media, and the Culture Industry / Douglas Kellner -- The Rise and Fall of the Limited Effects Model / Peter Simonson -- The Political Economy of Communication: An Idiosyncratic Presentation of an Emerging Subfield / Robert W. McChesney -- Unmasking Class and Tradition: Questioning Recuperative History and Affiliation in Cultural Studies / Cameron McCarthy and Jennifer Logue.

Volume II. Media Production. Media Studies: The Interdiscipline of the Present and the Future / Angharad N. Valdivia -- Making Media Production Visible: An Introduction / Vicki Mayer -- Part 1. Production Regimes and Infrastructures. The Governance of Communication and Culture: Regularizing the Regimes of Production and Consumption / / Katharine Sarikakis -- Media Production and Information Policy: Growth Through Replication / Patrick Burkart and Lucas Logan -- The Slippery Slopes of "Soft Power": Production Studies, International Relations, and the Military Industrial Media Complex / Jonathan Burston -- Television-Set Production in the Era of Digital TV / Mari Castañeda -- Citizenship and Media Ownership / John McMurria -- Part 2. The Cultural Industries and the Organization of Production. Music in the New Capitalism / Timothy D. Taylor -- Whither the Professional Book Publisher in an Era of Distribution on Demand / Laura J. Miller -- This Is What I Need, This Is What Will Travel: Television Programs in the Era of Transition / Shawn Shimpach -- How Should We Think About Audience Power in the Digital Age? / Joseph Turow -- Part 3. Product and Content Flows -- A Critical Analysis of Cultural Imperialism: From the Asian Frontlines / Dal Yong Jin -- Hollywood's Presence in Latin America: Production Participation to Distribution Dominance / Tamara L. Falicov -- Global Ugly Betty: International Format Trade and the Production of National Adaptations / Lothar Mikos and Marta Perrotta -- The Comings and Goings of Key Scenarios: TV Fiction, Culture, and Transnational Flows in Postcolonial Kinshasa / Katrien Pype -- Part 4. Production Work and Practices. Why Has News Production in the United States Remained Stable at a Time of Great Change? / David Michael Ryfe -- The Production of Mediated Performance / Espen Ytreberg -- Imagination and Censorship, Fiction and Reality: Producing a Telenovela in a Time of Political Crisis / Carolina Acosta-Alzuru -- Distributed Creativity in Film and Television: Three Case Studies of Networked Production Labor / John T. Caldwell, M.J. Clarke, Erin Hill, and Eric Vanstrom -- YouTube Stylo: Writing and Teaching with Digital Video / Alexandra Juhasz -- Part 5. Production Cultures. Queer Broadcasts: Backstage Television, Insider Material, and Media Producers / Quinn Miller -- Hollywood Elsewhere: The Runaway Locations Industry and Transnational Production Cultures / Serra Tinic -- Transformations and Tactics: The Production Culture of the Hong Kong Film Industry / Sylvia J. Martin -- Youth as Cultural Producers / Cultural Productions of Youth / Lora Taub-Pervizpour -- Part 6. The Ethics of Production. "What's TV Good For?": Views of Producers of Television for Children around the World / Dafna Lemish -- Is Media Work Good Work?: A Case Study of Television Documentary / David Hesmondhalgh and Anna Zoellner -- Community Media Production: Access, Institutions, and Ethics / Ellie Rennie -- Neglected Elements: Production, Labor, and the Environment / Richard Maxwell and Toby Miller.

Volume III. Content and Representation. Media Studies: The Interdiscipline of the Present and the Future / Angharad N. Valdivia -- Technology, Convergence, and Power: Current Trends in Text-Based Approaches to Media Studies / Sharon R. Mazzarella -- Part 1. Persuasion and Information. Understanding Hypercommercialized Media Texts / Matthew P. McAllister and Alexandra Nutter Smith -- And Now a Click from Our Sponsors: Changes in Children's Advertising in the United States / Nancy A. Jennings -- Women's Portraits Present in Print Fashion Advertisements: A Content Analysis of Spanish Fashion Magazines from 2002 to 2009 / Paloma Diaz Soloaga and Carlos Muñiz -- Marketing Militarism to Moms: News and Branding after September 11th / Mary Douglas Vavrus -- From Second-Wave to Postructuralist Feminism: Evolving Frameworks for Viewing Representations of Women's Sports / Hardin Marie -- Honey-Drenched, Rags to Riches, Good versus Evil Stories: The Telenovela as a Cultural Referent in the US Press / Guillermo Avila-Saavedra -- Changes in the News Representation of Minorities Over the Course of 40 Years of Research / Eli Avraham -- Is There Local Content on Television for Children Today? / Katalin Lustyik and Ruth Zanker -- -- Part 2. Entertainment. The Evolution of Hollywood Latinidad: Latina/o Representation and Stardom in US Entertainment Media / Mary C. Beltrán / -- Queer Gazing and the Popular: A Study on the Representational Strategies of Queer Representations in Popular Television Fiction / Sofie Van Bauwel, Frederik Dhaenens, and Daniel Biltereyst -- Mediated Portrayals of Masculinities / Heather L. Hundley -- Shifting Contours of Indian Womanhood in Popular Hindi Cinema / Sujata Moorti -- Portrayals of Female Scientists in the Mass Media: End Times for a Media History Paradigm / Jocelyn Steinke -- She's the Real Thing: Filming the Nostalgic Past through Vietnamese Women / Diem-My T. Bui -- Chinese Cinema at the Millennium: Defining "China" and the Politics of Representation / Gina Marchetti -- Violent Content on US Television: A Historical Overview of the Research / Nancy Signorielli -- Part 3. Interaction and Performance. Blogging Culture: Content and Representation in Blogs / Zizi Papacharissi and Sharon Meraz -- Blogging the Third Wave? Citizens' Media, Intimate Citizenship, and Everyday Life / Jenny Gunnarsson Payne -- Videogame Content: Game, Text, or Something Else? / Mia Consalvo -- Rethinking Violent Videogame Content: Conceptual Advances and Directions for Future Research / Kenneth A. Lachlan -- Transmedial Aesthetics: Where Form and Content Meet-Film and Videogames / Tanya Krzywinska -- Recent Trends in Research on Health Portrayals in the Media: From TV, Newspapers, and Magazines to Websites, YouTube, and Manga / James D. Robinson, Teresa L. Thompson, Jeanine Warisse Turner, Robert R. Agne, and Yan Tian -- Canadian (Re)Presentation: Media, First Peoples, and Liveness in the Museum / Miranda J. Brady -- Calypso and the Performance of Representational Politics / Susan Harewood.

Volume IV. Audience and Interpretation. Media Studies: The Interdiscipline of the Present and the Future / Angharad N. Valdivia -- Studying the Elusive Audience: Consumers, Readers, Users, and Viewers in a Changing World / Radhika Parameswaran -- Part 1. Expanding the Horizons of Audience Studies. The Audience in the Graduate Curriculum: Training Future Scholars / Meenakshi Gigi Durham -- Fostering Surprise and Productive Discomfort in Audience Studies through Multi-Sited Ethnography / Kim Trager-Bohley -- Studying Audiences with Sense-Making Methodology: End Times for a Media History Paradigm / CarrieLynn D. Reinhard and Brenda Dervin -- The Abbreviated Field Experience in Audience Ethnography : End Times for a Media History Paradigm / Patrick D. Murphy-- Part 2. Practicing Reflexivity In and Out of the Field. Studying Addiction: My Journey Through the Landscape of Telenovela Consumption / Carolina Acosta-Alzuru -- The Reflexive Self: The Expressive Subject in Makeover Television and Audience Research / Katherine Sender -- Reflexivity in Data Analysis: Constructing Narratives of Family Digital Media Use In, Through, and For Public Engagement / Lynn Schofield Clark -- Media Ethnography: Thickness and Force / Matt Briggs -- Nomadic Scholarship: Translocal Approach to Audience Studies / Fabienne Darling-Wolf -- Part 3. Finding and Engaging Global Audiences. Mythic Viewing: Reality in Indian Audiencehood / Vamsee Juluri -- Unity in Diversity? South African Women's Reception of National and Global Images of Belonging / Shelley-Jean Bradfield -- A Framework for Audience Study of Transnational Television / Chua Beng Huat -- Language and Indian Film Audiences: From Political Economy To Ethnography / Sunitha Chitrapu -- Watching Telenovelas in Brazil: Mediating the Everyday / Antonio C. La Pastina -- China's Media Transformation and Audience Research / Li Hongmei -- Using Ethnography to Understand Everyday Media Practices in Australian Family Life / Donell Holloway and Lelia Green -- Part 4. Comprehending Online Audiences. Beyond the Active Audience: Exploring New Media Audiences and the Limits of Cultural Production / Shayla Thiel-Stern -- Counting, and Accounting for, Online Audiences / Fernando Bermejo -- Always at Crossroads: Studying Online/Offline Intersections as a Postcolonial Feminist Researcher / Radhika Gajjala -- Studying Online News Audiences: Trends, Issues, and Challenges / Deborah S. Chung -- Part 5. Empowering Audiences As Citizens. Health, Culture, and Power: Understanding Women Audiences of Health Media / Linda Aldoory -- Participation Beyond Production: Possibilities for Reception and Ritual in the Study of Activist Audiences / Jennifer Rauch -- Audiences as Citizens: Insights from Three Decades of Reception Research / Kim Christian Schrøder -- Citizenship, Communication, and Modes of Audience Engagement: Exploring Alternative Voices in the Public Sphere / Christine L. Garlough and Dhavan V. Shah.

Volume V. Media Effects/Media Psychology. Media Studies: The Interdiscipline Of The Present and the Future / Angharad N. Valdivia -- Changes And Continuities In The Media Effects Paradigm / Erica Scharrer -- Part 1. Theories and Processes/Processing. Theories of/about Effects. Mapping the Psychology of Agenda Setting / Maxwell McCombs and Jae Kook Lee -- Cultivation Theory: Television Fiction as a Vector of Socialization / Jan Van den Bulck -- Framing and Priming Effects: Exploring Challenges Connected to Cross-Level Approaches in Media Effects Research / Bertram T. Scheufele and Dietram A. Scheufele -- Examining Media Effects: The General Aggression and General Learning Models / Christopher P. Barlett and Craig A. Anderson -- Perceptions of Media and Media Effects: The Third Person Effect, Trust in Media and Hostile Media Perceptions / Yariv Tsfati and Jonathan Cohen -- Internal Mechanisms: Enjoyment, Appeal, and Physiological Response. Uses and Gratifications: A Social and Psychological Perspective of Media Use and Effects / Paul Haridakis -- Media Entertainment as a Result of Recreation and Psychological Growth: Internal Mechanisms: Enjoyment, Appeal, and Physiological Response / Tilo Hartmann -- Selective Exposure to Violent Media: A Synthesis Of The Research And Theoretical Overview / Marina Krcmar -- Media Message Processing And The Embodied Mind: Measuring Bodily Responses To Open The Black Box / Annie Lang -- Thoughtless Vigilantes: Media Violence and Brain Activation Patterns in Young Viewers / John P. Murray -- Part 2. Evidence of Effects. On Views of Self, Others, and Events. Gender-Role Socialization in the Twenty-First Century / Nancy Signorielli -- Race and News Revisited: The Content and Effects of Problematically Framing the News / Travis L. Dixon and Christopher S. Josey -- The Influence of Media Exposure on the Formation, Activation, and Application of Racial/Ethnic Stereotypes / Dana Mastro and Riva Tukachinsky -- The Relationship between the Media, the Military, and the Public: Examining the Stories Told and Public Opinion / Michel M. Haigh -- On Personal Health and Social Well-Being. Understanding the Role of Cognition and Media in Body Image Disturbance and Weight Bias in Children, Adolescents, and Adults / Kim Bissell -- Tracing the Course of Reality TV Effects Research / Robin L. Nabi, Jiyeon So, and Theresa de los Santos -- Media-Related Fear: Short-Term And Enduring Consequences / Cynthia A. Hoffner and Elizabeth L. Cohen -- Callous/Malice: An Examination of Desensitizing and Aggression-Causing Media Effects / Ron Leone and Angela Paradise -- In the Political Arena. Sex on Television: A Review of Socialization Effects and the Role of Context and Individual Differences / Kirstie M. Farrar -- Political TV Advertising and Debates / William L. Benoit and Jayne R. Henson -- News and Political Entertainment Effects on Democratic Citizenship / Patricia Moy, Michael A. Xenos, and Muzammil M. Hussain -- Exploring Relations Between Political Entertainment Media And Traditional Political Communication Information Outlets: / A Research Agenda / R. Lance Holbert and Dannagal Goldthwaite Young -- Digital Democracy: How the Internet Has Changed Politics / Leticia Bode, Stephanie Edgerly, Ben Sayre, Emily K. Vraga, and Dhavan V. Shah -- On/Of Persuasion. Advances In Public Communication Campaigns / Charles K. Atkin and Ronald E. Rice -- Effects of Social Marketing: Potential and limitations / Michael D. Basil -- Using Message Framing in Health-Related Persuasion: Theory and Evidence / Xiaoli Nan -- The Intended and Unintended Effects of Advertising on Children / Moniek Buijzen and Patti M. Valkenburg -- Part 3. The Young Audience. Media Use and Effects on Learning and Development. Media Use, Scholastic Achievement, and Attention Span / George Comstock -- The Educational Impact Of Television: Understanding Television's Potential And Limitations / Daniel R. Anderson, Heather J. Lavigne, and Katherine G. Hanson -- Prosocial TV Content: Children's Interpretations And Responses / Marie-Louise Mares -- The Effects Of Internet Communication On Adolescents' Psychological Development: An Assessment Of Risks And Opportunities / Jochen Peter and Patti M. Valkenburg -- Mediating and Mitigating Effects. Boom or Boomerang: A Critical Review of Evidence Documenting Media Literacy Efficacy / Smita C. Banerjee and Robert Kubey -- The Role Of Parental Mediation In the Development Of Media Literacy and the Prevention of Substance Use / Yi-Chun (Yvonnes) Chen and Erica Weintraub Austin -- The impact of media policy on children's media exposure / Amy B. Volume VI. Media Studies Futures. Media Studies: The Interdiscipline of the Present and the Future / Angharad N. Valdivia -- Introduction: Media Studies Futures, Past and Present / Kelly Gates -- Part 1. The Future of Media Studies: Theory, Methods, Pedagogy. Media Studies: Diagnostics Of A Failed Merger / Angharad N. Valdivia and Geert Lovink -- In Praise of Concept Production: Formats, Schools, and Nonrepresentational Media Studies / Geert Lovink and Ned Rossiter -- Betting on YouTube Futures (for New Media Writing and Publishing) / Alexandra Juhasz -- Media Visualization: Visual Techniques For Exploring Large Media Collections / Lev Manovich -- The Future of Game Studies / Yariv Tsfati and Jonathan Cohen -- The Study of the Internet in Latin America: Achievements, Challenges, Futures / Raúl Trejo Delarbre -- Part 2. Social and Mobile Media Futures. The Prehistoric Turn? Networked New Media, Mobility, and the Body / Mark Coté -- The Waning Distinction Between Private And Public: Net Locality And The Restructuring Of Space / Adriana de Souza e Silva and Eric Gordon -- How To Have Social Media In An Invisible Pandemic: Hepatitis C in the Time of H1N / Lisa Cartwright -- Mobile Handsets From The Bottom Up: Appropriation And Innovation In The Global South / Angharad N. Valdivia, Cara Wallis, Jack Linchuan Qiu, and Rich Ling -- Part 3. Media Industry and Infrastructure Futures. The End Of James Cameron's Quiet Years / Charles R. Acland -- Infrastructural Changeover: The US Digital TV Transition and Media Futures / Lisa Parks -- The 800-Pound Gorillas in the Room: The Mobile Phone and the Future of Television / Max Dawson -- Preemption, Premediation, Prediction: The Politics of Betting on the Future / Greg Elmer and Andy Opel -- Part 4. Journalism and Media Policy Futures. The Decline of Modern Journalism in the Neo-Partisan Era / Campbell Richard and Jonathan Cohen -- Reconstructing Accountability: Essential Journalistic Reorientations / Martin Eide -- Mending the Gaps: Connecting Media Policy and Media Studies / Victor Pickard -- Part 5. Interactivity, Affect, and the Future of Media Subjectivities. From Audiences to Media Subjectivities: Mutants in the Interregnum / Jack Z. Bratich -- Future Directions for Political Communication Scholarship: Considering Emotion in Mediated Public Participation / Karin Wahl-Jorgensen -- The Future of New Media: Embodying Kurzweil's Singularity in Dollhouse, Battlestar Galactica, and Gamer / David Golumbia -- It's a Nigger in Here! Kill the Nigger! User-Generated Media Campaigns Against Racism, Sexism, and Homophobia in Digital / Lisa Nakamura -- From "The Ultimate Display" to "The Ultimate Skinner Box": Virtual Reality and the Future of Psychotherapy / Marisa Brandt -- Part 6. Whose Futures? Children, Youth Cultures, and Digital Media. Mapping ICT Adoption among Latin American Youth / Rosalía Winocur and Carolina Aguerre -- South Asian Digital Diasporas: Remixing Diasporic Youth Cultures / Radhika Gajjala and Yeon Ju Oh -- Fear and Hope: The Politics of Childhood and Mobile Media / Damien Spry -- Part 7. What Future? Or, the Unsustainable Present. Artificial Life on a Dead Planet / Charles Thorpe -- The Dead-End of Consumerism: The Role of the Media and Cultural Industries / Justin Lewis -- Media Armageddons and the Death of Liberal Biopolitics / Majia Holmer Nadesan -- Greening Cultural Labor: The Future of Media Accounting / Richard Maxwell and Toby Miller.

Volume VII. Research Methods in Media Studies. Media Studies: The Interdiscipline of the Present and the Future / Angharad N. Valdivia -- Convergence, Globalization, Technological Development, and Interdisciplinarity in a Fast-Evolving World: The Formidable Question of Method / Fabienne Darling-Wolf -- Part 1. Setting Up the Stage. Media Research Paradigms: Conceptual Distinctions, Continuing Divisions / Slavko Splichal and Peter Dahlgren -- The Challenge of Media Research Ethics / Kevin Healey -- Part 2. Working with People. Doing Survey Research in Media Studies / Suman Mishra -- Beyond the Qualitative/Quantitative "Divide": Reflections on the Utility and Challenges of Q Methodology for Media Researchers / Carolyn Michelle and Charles H. Davis -- The Interview: A Process of Qualitative Inquiry / Sue Robinson -- Oral History Interviews: Advantages and Challenges of Employing Oral History Interviewing as Part of a Research Project / Mike Conway -- Memories of Films and Cinema-Going in Monterrey, Mexico: A Critique and Review of In-Depth Interviews as a Methodological Strategy in Audience Studies / Lorena Frankenberg and José Carlos Lozano -- Conducting Media Ethnographies in Africa / Tanja Bosch -- Autoethnography in Media Studies: Digitalization of Television in Finland, or Carrying Home Cardboard Boxes / Johanna Uotinen -- The Basics of Experimental Research in Media Studies / Glenn Leshner -- Between-Subjects Experimental Design and Analysis / Kim Bissell -- Part 3. Working with Texts. Using a Mixed Approach to Content Analysis: The Case of Apologetic Rhetoric in the Modern Presidency / Rico Neumann and Kevin Coe -- Lessons Learned from a Research Saga: An Ambitious Content Analysis of Television Form / Matthew Lombard -- Text-Based Approaches to Qualitative Research: An Overview of Methods, Process, and Ethics / Sara McKinnon -- Analyzing Text: The Cultural Discourse in Ethnic Food Reviews / Elfriede Fürsich -- Cultural History and Media Studies / Richard K. Popp -- Historical Approaches to Media Studies / Mark Hampton -- Film Analysis / James Walters -- Eye Tracking in Media Studies: Theory, Method, and Its Exemplary Application in Analyzing Shock-Inducing Advertisements / Stephanie Geise -- Exploring Visual Aspects of Audience Membership: Media Studies and Photovoice / David R. Novak and Tonny Krijnen -- Part 4. Virtual Challenges, Interdisciplinary Research, and Mixed Method Research. The Methodology of Online News Analysis: A Quantitative Approach to Ephemeral Media / Helle Sjøvaag and Eirik Stavelin -- Digital Ethnography and Media Practices / Elisenda Ardévol and Edgar Gómez-Cruz -- Clicks and Bricks: Methods and Strategies for Measuring the Effects of Similar Virtual and Physical Activity / Lillian C. Spina-Caza -- Exploring the Effects of TV and Movie Music on Childhood / Amparo Porta -- Latino Diasporas and the Media: Interdisciplinary Approaches to Understanding Transnationalism and Communication / Jéssica Retis.
